attributes.action: Intervene on behalf of Nurse Margaret Haywood who has been struck off for undercover filming of the terrible standards of care for elderly patients.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Margaret Haywood filmed at the Royal Sussex Hospital in Brighton for a BBC Panorama programme in July 2005.

She was struck off by the Nursing and Midwifery Council on Thursday after being a nurse for more than 20 years.

Ms Haywood said: "I am absolutely devastated and upset by it all. I think I have been treated very harshly."

"It is a serious issue and I knew it was a risk I was taking but I thought the filming was justified and it was in the public interest.

"I always made it clear to the BBC that patients would come first at all times."

She said she had voiced her concerns through her immediate line manager "but nothing was really taken on board".

She was found guilty of misconduct on Wednesday 15th April following a fitness to practise hearing.'

Ms Haywood had her patients interests at heart by exposing the serious shortcomings in the standards of care they are provided with. The fact that she had tried to raise this with her line manager and no action was taken shows she had to resort to more serious means to be heard.

We ask that the prime minister intervene in Ms Haywood's case to have her reinstated as a nurse.
